[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Client state] Can GRPC client state become corrupted if send_message() is called concurrently from multiple tasks (even though get_mut ensures exclusivity)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Type spoofing] Can an attacker craft messages with message_type values that match system-reserved types like 'stop_task'? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Error information leak] Does the warn!() log at line 129-134 expose sensitive information about validator internals that could aid attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Error handling completeness] Does returning immediately on receiver error prevent cleanup of resources, causing resource leaks in the spawned task? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: start()] [Panic propagation] If the spawned async task panics, does it crash the entire validator process, or is it isolated? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Silent failures] Can GRPC send_message() fail silently without logging, making it impossible to detect message loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: start()] [Vec capacity] Does mem::take() leave the handlers Vec with pre-allocated capacity that wastes memory after start() completes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: start()] [HashMap capacity] Does the grpc_clients HashMap pre-allocate capacity based on remote_addresses.len(), or does it grow incrementally causing reallocations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Address comparison] Does SocketAddr comparison use exact IP:port matching, or can IPv4/IPv6 equivalence issues cause self-message detection to fail? (Medium)
